intro: Macrostylis villosa, commonly known as the hairy macrostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the sunflower family. It is native to South America and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Macrostylis villosa is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
